Hello, IMHO the formatter in the log should be fixed! It might be right that 
the datetime in log file is good as long as it's readable. But the wrong 
formats are really odd and we consider them as G11N enablement failure. If 
it's not intended to be formatted based on Locale (formatter = 
DateFormat.getInstance(....)), ISO8601 is strongly recommended. 
(http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime-970915.html). Otherwise Masayuki Fuse's 
suggestion to use "yyyy-MM-dd" is acceptable since it's still ISO8601 
compliant.

The difference between "MMM dd, yyyy HH:mm:ss.SS" and "yyyy-MM-dd" is more 
than MEDIUM format vs. SHORT format; the former uses LONG month name which 
will be localized when writing to log file, while the latter uses only digits 
in month. So "May 25, 2004" will become "2004-05-24" which would avoid 
introducing confusion for any locale. Not only CJK, but also from other 
languages, users won't be happy if the format is hardcoded but month names are 
translated. For example, a German user sees "Mai 24, 2004" s/he would think 
it's incorrect.

Also, the log file may expose to user directly thru the Error log view;-)

Thank you for your attention and consideration.
